directionsData.title: Each rating should be considered in the context of what is appropriate for the age of your child.When completing this form, please think about your child’s behaviors in the past 6 months.

child.title: Is this evaluation based on a time when the child

carelessmistakes.title: Does not pay attention to details or makes careless mistakes  with, for example, homework

attention.title: Has difficulty keeping attention to what needs to be done

spokendirectly.title: Does not seem to listen when spoken to directly

activities.title: Does not follow through when given directions and fails to finish activities (not due to refusal or failure to understand)

organizing.title: Has difficulty organizing tasks and activities

dislikes.title: Avoids, dislikes, or does not want to start tasks that require ongoing mental effort

tasksactivities.title: Loses things necessary for tasks or activities (toys, assignments, pencils, or books)

distracted.title: Is easily distracted by noises or other stimuli

Fidgets.title: Fidgets with hands or feet or squirms in seat

remaining.title: Leaves seat when remaining seated is expected

climbs.title: Runs about or climbs too much when remaining seated is expected

playing.title: Has difficulty playing or beginning quiet play activities

drivenmotor.title: Is “on the go” or often acts as if  “driven by a motor”

questions.title: Blurts out answers before questions have been completed

waiting.title: Has difficulty waiting his or her turn

conversations.title: Interrupts or intrudes in on others’ conversations and/or activities

refuses.title: Actively defies or refuses to go along with adults’ requests or rules

mistakes.title: Blames others for his or her mistakes or misbehaviors

touchy.title: Is touchy or easily annoyed by others

spiteful.title: Is spiteful and wants to get even

trouble.title: Lies to get out of trouble or to avoid obligations (ie, “cons” others)

truant.title: Is truant from school (skips school) without permission

stolen.title: Has stolen things that have value

weapon.title: Has used a weapon that can cause serious harm (bat, knife, brick, gun)

deliberately.title: Has deliberately set fires to cause damage

broken.title: Has broken into someone else’s home, business, or car

stayed.title: Has stayed out at night without permission

overnight.title: Has run away from home overnight

forced.title: Has forced someone into sexual activity

mistakes.title: Is afraid to try new things for fear of making mistakes

guilty.title: Blames self for problems, feels guilty

unwanted.title: Feels lonely, unwanted, or unloved; complains that “no one loves him or her”

inquestionsseven.title: Total number of questions scored 4 or 5 in questions 48–55
